intro: Anil arrecta, commonly known as the sacred lotus, is a tropical aquatic plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom on long, erect stems above the water surface. The plant has broad, heart-shaped leaves that are typically floating or partially submerged. Its roots system helps stabilize the soil and improve water quality. Anil arrecta is also culturally significant in many Asian countries, symbolizing purity and spiritual enlightenment.
